title: Zombie (EvilHack)
data:
In [EvilHack](/wiki/EvilHack "EvilHack"), **[zombies](/wiki/Zombie "Zombie")** can be any of the variations encountered in *[NetHack](/wiki/NetHack "NetHack")*, with the addition of a few new variations:

- Z [kobold zombie](/wiki/Kobold_zombie "Kobold zombie")
- Z [gnome zombie](/wiki/Gnome_zombie "Gnome zombie")
- Z [orc zombie](/wiki/Orc_zombie "Orc zombie")
- Z [dwarf zombie](/wiki/Dwarf_zombie "Dwarf zombie")
- Z [hobbit zombie](/wiki/Hobbit_zombie "Hobbit zombie")
- Z [elf zombie](/wiki/Elf_zombie "Elf zombie")
- Z [drow zombie](/wiki/Drow_zombie_\(EvilHack\) "Drow zombie (EvilHack)")
- Z [human zombie](/wiki/Human_zombie "Human zombie")
- Z [gnoll witherling](/wiki/Gnoll_witherling "Gnoll witherling")
- Z [ettin zombie](/wiki/Ettin_zombie "Ettin zombie")
- Z [giant zombie](/wiki/Giant_zombie "Giant zombie")

## Description

EvilHack zombies behave similarly to the [zombies](/wiki/Zombie_\(GruntHack\) "Zombie (GruntHack)") in [GruntHack](/wiki/GruntHack "GruntHack"), though they have their own entries in [monst.c](/wiki/Monst.c "Monst.c") rather than [racial monster](/wiki/Racial_monster "Racial monster") templates, and several modifications are made to keep them distinct and less overwhelmingly difficult while still being quite challenging.

Zombies can transfer illness the same way as in GruntHack - either via their bite or a player consuming their corpse - and monsters with zombie forms that are killed by a zombie will eventually revive as one; a player killed this way may rarely be able to continue on as a zombie with permanent unchanging. A zombie's claw attack is also poisonous, which occurs with frequency similar to that of a [rabid rat](/wiki/Rabid_rat "Rabid rat"), and their brain-eating bite can cause intelligence loss along with [illness](/wiki/Illness "Illness") - in previous versions, the bite can also cause [amnesia](/wiki/Amnesia "Amnesia"). Fortunately, they also have a lower chance of [reviving](/wiki/Reviving "Reviving") from their corpse, and they will not revive at all if [cancelled](/wiki/Cancelled "Cancelled") or [beheaded](/wiki/Behead "Behead").

## Strategy

The same methods for permanently disposing of zombies in GruntHack and [trolls](/wiki/Troll_\(monster_class\) "Troll (monster class)") in *NetHack* are generally applicable in EvilHack, with some notable differences and several additional means of killing zombies or disposing of their corpses.

Zombie corpses will always cause terminal illness when eaten, making it possible to permanently get rid of them by eating one and then using a reliable illness cure such as a unicorn horn. [Lava](/wiki/Lava "Lava") is slightly more common in the main dungeon, making it easier to burn up the corpses by [dipping](/wiki/Dip "Dip"), throwing or dropping them into the lava square; dipping a zombie corpse into a [forge](/wiki/Forge_\(dungeon_feature\) "Forge (dungeon feature)") will also incinerate it. [Sunsword](/wiki/Sunsword "Sunsword") can vaporize zombies it kills permanently, including a chance of instantly destroying them similar to other [Bane](/wiki/Bane "Bane")-style weapons in EvilHack.

Helms will more reliably prevent the effects of a zombie's bites compared to GruntHack, and helms that are greased or oilskin will block them outright; [applying](/wiki/Apply "Apply") [barding](/wiki/Barding "Barding") to a a steed can protect them from zombie bites. [Illithids](/wiki/Illithid_\(starting_race\) "Illithid (starting race)") and mind flayers have [psychic resistance](/index.php?title=Psychic_resistance\&action=edit\&redlink=1 "Psychic resistance (page does not exist)"), giving them immunity to the brain-targeting secondary effects of a zombie bite, though they can still be poisoned and made ill. The [cure sickness](/wiki/Cure_sickness "Cure sickness") spell (which is made directional) can not only reliably cure zombification for you and monsters that you cast it at, but also damages zombies in the path of the beam.

## Hack'EM

[Hack'EM](/wiki/Hack%27EM "Hack'EM") retains the zombies from EvilHack and their behaviors, and adds two more zombies the [zombie](/wiki/Zombie_\(monster_class\) "Zombie (monster class)") [monster class](/wiki/Monster_class "Monster class"):

- Z [centaur zombie](/index.php?title=Centaur_zombie\&action=edit\&redlink=1 "Centaur zombie (page does not exist)")
- Z [dragon zombie](/index.php?title=Dragon_zombie\&action=edit\&redlink=1 "Dragon zombie (page does not exist)")

In addition to the above traits, zombies can cause amnesia and are vulnerable to the wands of [healing](/wiki/Wand_of_healing "Wand of healing") and [extra healing](/wiki/Wand_of_extra_healing "Wand of extra healing").

From NetHackWiki

In EvilHack, zombies can be any of the variations encountered in NetHack, with the addition of a few new variations:

  • Z kobold zombie
  • Z gnome zombie
  • Z orc zombie
  • Z dwarf zombie
  • Z hobbit zombie
  • Z elf zombie
  • Z drow zombie
  • Z human zombie
  • Z gnoll witherling
  • Z ettin zombie
  • Z giant zombie

EvilHack zombies behave similarly to the zombies in GruntHack, though they have their own entries in monst.c rather than racial monster templates, and several modifications are made to keep them distinct and less overwhelmingly difficult while still being quite challenging.

A zombie's claw attack is also poisonous, which occurs with frequency similar to that of a rabid rat, and their brain-eating bite can cause intelligence loss along with illness - in previous versions, the bite can also cause amnesia. Fortunately, they also have a lower chance of reviving from their corpse, and they will not revive at all if cancelled or beheaded.

Strategy

The same methods for permanently disposing of zombies in GruntHack and trolls in NetHack are generally applicable in EvilHack, with some notable differences and several additional means of killing zombies or disposing of their corpses.

Zombie corpses will always cause terminal illness when eaten, making it possible to permanently get rid of them by eating one and then using a reliable illness cure such as a unicorn horn. Lava is slightly more common in the main dungeon, making it easier to burn up the corpses by dipping, throwing or dropping them into the lava square; dipping a zombie corpse into a forge will also incinerate it. Sunsword can vaporize zombies it kills permanently, including a chance of instantly destroying them similar to other Bane-style weapons in EvilHack.

Helms will more reliably prevent the effects of a zombie's bites compared to GruntHack, and helms that are greased or oilskin will block them outright; applying barding to a a steed can protect them from zombie bites. The cure sickness spell (which is made directional) can not only reliably cure zombification for you and monsters that you cast it at, but also damages zombies in the path of the beam.

Hack'EM

Hack'EM retains the zombies from EvilHack and their behaviors, and adds two more zombies the zombie monster class:

  • Z centaur zombie
  • Z dragon zombie

In addition to the above traits, zombies can cause amnesia and are vulnerable to the wands of healing and extra healing.
